resources.string:
Please read carefully the following privacy statement of Smart Presence.
 Smart presence is collecting your personal information including locations, WiFi connection, email, address, etc. This application will access your locations or WiFi information in order to detect your presence in target building, and will also need your personal information to configure the firebase cloud firestore database which will store all of your data. Since Smart presence focuses on residential area, the address of your home is also needed. 
 We promise that your information will not be exposed and accessed by anyone else. On top of that, your information will not be used for commercial use and we will guarantee the security of the database so that your personal information will be preserved. Moreover, you have the right to delete your account and all data. As a result, no copy of your data will be kept. 
 By signing this agreement, you agree to grant all-time-positioning permission, stop the battery optimization for Smart Presence and potentially change settings dealing with devices from certain manufacturers. You agree to provide information about locations, address and email. You have read and understood all the sections written above.
If you haven\'t change the settings, please do it manually: grant all time positioning permission & stop battery optimization.
The duration between two consecutive detections. If you are always away from home for a long time, you can choose a longer duration to save battery.
You can choose when the detection will start or stop during a day. Please note that the stop time should come after the start time.
You have successfully deleted you data stored in cloud database!
You will receive a push notification at 14:00 everyday!
You will no longer receive the daily push notification!

resources.string: Are you sure you want to delete all your data stored in cloud database?

If the current information is not correct or you don\'t know what should be inputted in the fields, please click the button to show the WiFi information about current WiFi connection, otherwise, please input manually.
Click the button to select your target building from a map. In any case, please make sure the inputs are as same as those from users in the same target building.
The maximum number of people staying in the target building.
You have successfully configured your profile.
Please make sure you are connecting to WiFi or input manually.
Please do not leave empty space.
Please turn on your location service.
Please restart your WiFi connection and location service.
You have successfully selected your location.
By turning on the battery saving mode, you will rely on the so-called geofence to detect presence, which is not accurate because it depends on the location update from other apps!
By turning off the battery saving mode, the accuracy of detection is increased, but you may experience quicker battery drop!
You have already turn off the battery optimization for this app.
You have already granted the permission for this app.

Welcome to Smart Presence. The objective of this application is to detect your presence in target building and derive the building occupancy profile to help with your smart building management. In general, we provide three methods for you to choose: WiFi based method, positioning based method and manual method. 
 
 WiFi based: the app will periodically compare the SSID (WiFi name) and BSSID (a unique ID assigned by the router) of your current WiFi connection with the target one configured by you so that you will be considered as being present if the they match. As a result, the app can derive the period of you staying or leaving the target building. 
 
 Positioning based: the concept is that you will be considered as presence if you are within a certain range around the target building. In particular, the app can either periodically update your location with latitude and longitude to check your presence, which costs more battery or passively listen the location updates from other apps to trigger a geofence, which is less energy consumed. 
 
 Manual method: you simply need to click the shortcuts provided by the app to check in or out anytime you entering or leaving the target building. It totally relies on your habits. 
 
 We strongly suggest that before starting the services, go to setting page in which you can deal with your account, change the interval between two detections, change for what period during a day the service should work, determine whether to receive daily notification or not and change language. 
 
 Finally, the app will work in the background and your data will be upload and stored in firestore database for further analysis.
If you have not grant the all time positioning permission and stop battery optimization, please do it manually.
Furthermore, for devices from certain manufacturers, you may need to manually change some settings. Please check out here.

Huawei: even if you have disabled the battery optimization from the app, you still need to do it in your system setting page. Moreover, for older version of Huawei devices, the app works not perfectly due to intrinsic property of its customized Android system which significantly limit the background services, thus, please turn on the daily notification and re-start the service everyday or when you wakeup in the morning. However, for later version, due to the restriction of Google, the positioning based method does not work due to the fact that Google play service no longer supports Huawei.

Samsung: it does put some restrictions on background service so that please turn on the daily notification. On the other hand, you still need to manually grant the permission to run background service.
OnePlus: you have to manually disable to battery optimization which cannot be stopped in the app for onePlus.
MEIZU: you need to go to the system setting page and find "privacy and security", in which you can enable the background running for this application.
For more information, please contact s287288@studenti.polito.it.

In order to utilize the WiFi connection to detect user's presence, you need to follow several steps: 
 
 1. Go to the configuration page by clicking the three dots on right-top corner. 
 
 2. In the configuration page, you can generate SSID and BSSID of your current WiFi connection or manually input them (in such case, please make sure you are right!!!). You also need to decide the address which can be inputted manually or selected from a map. At last, you need to define what is the maximum occupancy of target building. 
 
 3. Click on right-top corner to save your configuration and then come back to this page. 
 
 4. Click "START" to start the service and then the service will run in the background automatically according to your settings. 
 
 5. You can click "STOP" to terminate the service. The "START" button will become "RESTART" after clicking "START" so that you can restart your service whenever you want. 
 
 6. Additionally, you can also click "SHOW WORKING STATUS" to check current service condition (ENQUEUED: the service is waiting in the line for the next detection; RUNNING: the service is running and performing the detection; CANCELLED: the service has been terminated by you; NOTHING: you have not define any service).
You have successfully started the service!
You have successfully stopped the service!
You have successfully restarted the service!
The status of your current service is:

In order to utilize the Google positioning service to detect user's presence, you need to follow several steps: 
 
 1. Go to the configuration page by clicking the three dots on right-top corner. 
 
 2. In the configuration page, you need the address and location (latitude and longitude) of target building, which can be inputted manually (in such case, please make sure the inputs are right!!!) or selected from a map. Moreover, you need to define what is the maximum occupancy of target building. At last, you can also choose to whether to disable battery saving mode or not. If you stick to default one without battery saving, the app will update location by itself periodically, which may cost more battery. On the other hand, if you change to battery saving mode, you won't have significant battery drop, however, the accuracy of detection is not good since the app will refer to so-called geofence which totally relies on the location update from other apps. We suggest that you can turn on the battery saving mode only when you often use apps which will require location service, e.g. Google Map. 
 
 3. Click on right-top corner to save your configuration and then come back to this page. 
 
 4. Click "START" to start the service and then the service will run in the background automatically according to your settings. 
 
 5. You can click "STOP" to terminate the service. The "START" button will become "RESTART" after clicking "START" so that you can restart your service whenever you want. 
 
 6. Additionally, you can also click "SHOW WORKING STATUS" to check current service condition (ENQUEUED: the service is waiting in the line for the next detection; RUNNING: the service is running and performing the detection or the geofence is working; CANCELLED: the service has been terminated by you; NOTHING: you have not define any service or the geofence triggering has been stopped).

This method totally rely on your habits of clicking on the buttons whenever you entering or leaving the target building, which is not easy for daily routines, so please only choose this method if you believe you can remember it and do not want your location or WiFi connection be exposed. 
 
 In order to manually record the entering or leaving to determine user's presence, you need to follow several steps: 
 
 1. Go to the configuration page by clicking the three dots on right-top corner. 
 
 2. In the configuration page, you need the address of target building, which can be inputted manually (in such case, please make sure the inputs are right!!!) or selected from a map. Finally, you need to define what is the maximum occupancy of target building. 
 
 3. Click on right-top corner to save your configuration and then come back to this page. 
 
 4. Click "CHECK IN" to record your entering whenever you enter the target building and the data will be uploaded. 
 
 5. Click "CHECK OUT" to record your leaving whenever you leave the target building and the data will be uploaded. 
 
 Note that we provide shortcuts for these two buttons so that you can long-click on the icon of the app and then drag the shortcuts to somewhere convenient. As a result, you don't have to come to this page to check in or out every time.
The entering has been successfully recorded!
The leaving has been successfully recorded!
If the map is not centered in your current location, please open Google map and restart the app.
Please click the three dots on top-right corner and make sure you have finished the configuration.
The GeoCoder service is not implemented in your devices, you need to input the address manually.
The pushed notification service is somehow stopped, please try to restart it later.
Cannot log in now, please try it later.
You have successfully created your account and logged in.
The user name should be an email.
The email is used, please choose another one.
The passwords are not the same.
The password you input is not correct.
Your check-in action has been recorded.
Your check-out action has been recorded.
Please configure your profile before checking in or out.
As a professional, you can visualize the occupancy profile in graphs and potentially perform other actions.
Average value for each hour during a day
Currently, no data is available for this option.
Sorry, the app has problems showing graph, which may due to connection failure or other reasons. Please try it later.
Beside the normal one, you will receive daily pushed notification more frequently, once at 7:00 and once at 18:00.
You will no longer receive frequent notification.

We strongly suggest you to turn on the daily notification so that you can restart your background service in case it stops. We will inspect the behaviour of your smart phone and we will let you know when you need to turn on the frequent notification.

We detect that the background service does not perform very well in your device. We strongly suggested that you turn on the frequent notification to remind yourself to restart the service more frequently. Thanks.

Dear user, the app relies strongly on the background service and it may requires some customized settings in your device, which cannot be modified by the app itself but only by you manually, so please make sure you have enabled the permission or changed the settings to allow background service for this app!!! Moreover, you also need to enable WiFi and location service!!! Thank you for your cooperation.
The radius that defines the range in which you will be considered as presence. The larger the value, the less energy consumed.
You have the right to require to delete your data stored remotely. You can also switch to regular mode.
You have the right to require to delete your data stored remotely. You can also switch to professional mode.
By switching to professional mode, you can also visualize your building occupancy profile and potentially perform other actions.
By switching to regular mode, you will go back to the layout with basic features.
We notice that the WiFi and location services have been turned off. They are very crucial to the app. Please enable them.
We notice that the location services has been turned off. It is very crucial to the app. Please enable it.
We notice that the WiFi services has been turned off. It is very crucial to the app. Please enable it.

string-array.name: question_list
string-array.item: Which method should I use for presence detection?
Why do I have to disable the battery optimization?
Why do I have to grant the all time positioning permission?
What device settings should I change?
Why the app does not work properly?
Which mode should I select, regular or professional?
For WiFi checking method, what is SSID and BSSID?
What kind of time setting should I refer to?
How can I get the professional access permission?
Why I cannot use the map to select address?

string-array.name: answer_list
string-array.item: We have provided three methods in total. In general, the WiFi method is the most recommended one because it is simple and reliable. However, if there\'s no WiFi device installed in your target building or you simply do not want to use WiFi, the positioning method is a more versatile one which only requires the location service of your smart phone, but it is not as reliable as the previous one and may consume more battery. At last, there is always the manual one, but you need to manually click the check in/out button, which totally relies on your habit. The advantage of it is that it is very reliable and accurate.

The core function of this app will exploit the feature of Android background work periodically in a long term, which may be affected and stopped due to battery optimization. In order to guarantee the continuity of the service to derive a reliable occupancy profile, it is mandatory to do it.

First of all, the service will work for very long time in the background, which can be done only by all time permission. Secondly, both of the WiFi method and positioning method require location service to be turned on to access certain information.

This totally depend on the specific device you are using since different manufacturers have their own customized Android system which limit the background service in different way. In general, the most common settings you need to vary are: all time positioning permission, battery optimization, background service allowance.
There are several scenarios: permissions are not granted; background service is restricted; WiFi service is turned off; location service is turned off; you seldom use your phone.

In most cases, it is suggested to select regular mode since it is lightweight and simple. If you are an expert or related personnel, the professional mode can help you to perform more actions remotely. However, it is totally up to you, the professional mode won\'t cost you more.

SSID is the so-called service set identifier, which is simply the WiFi name while BSSID is basic service set identifier, which is a 48-bit label assigned by the router. They are both used to identify the router in the target building.

Normally, it is suggested to follow the default ones, since they have higher accuracy and can cover most meaningful time period during a day. However, you can choose to customize based on your own behaviour. For instance, if you always work outside during the night, you need to change the stop time to a late time instance.

You need to be an expert who works with our desktop software, in which you can retrieve the code for permission. Otherwise, even if you refer to professional mode, you can only access your own information.

There are multiple reasons: your location service is turned off or failed, your device does not support the so-called geocoder function, your device does not support google service, your internet connection is off. In any case, if you cannot access the address and location, you can always manually input them. However, you need to make sure that the address is exactly as same as other occupants and the location including latitude and longitude has to be correct and precise.

resources.string: Which method should I use for presence detection?

We have provided three methods in total. In general, the WiFi method is the most recommended one because it is simple and reliable. However, if there\'s no WiFi device installed in your target building or you simply do not want to use WiFi, the positioning method is a more versatile one which only requires the location service of your smart phone, but it is not as reliable as the previous one and may consume more battery. At last, there is always the manual one, but you need to manually click the check in/out button, which totally relies on your habit. The advantage of it is that it is very reliable and accurate.
Why do I have to disable the battery optimization?

The core function of this app will exploit the feature of Android background work periodically in a long term, which may be affected and stopped due to battery optimization. In order to guarantee the continuity of the service to derive a reliable occupancy profile, it is mandatory to do it.
Why do I have to grant the all time positioning permission?

First of all, the service will work for very long time in the background, which can be done only by all time permission. Secondly, both of the WiFi method and positioning method require location service to be turned on to access certain information.
What device settings should I change?

This totally depend on the specific device you are using since different manufacturers have their own customized Android system which limit the background service in different way. In general, the most common settings you need to vary are: all time positioning permission, battery optimization, background service allowance.
Why the app does not work properly?
There are several scenarios: permissions are not granted; background service is restricted; WiFi service is turned off; location service is turned off; you seldom use your phone.
Which mode should I select, regular or professional?

In most cases, it is suggested to select regular mode since it is lightweight and simple. If you are an expert or related personnel, the professional mode can help you to perform more actions remotely. However, it is totally up to you, the professional mode won\'t cost you more.
For WiFi checking method, what is SSID and BSSID?

SSID is the so-called service set identifier, which is simply the WiFi name while BSSID is basic service set identifier, which is a 48-bit label assigned by the router. They are both used to identify the router in the target building.
What kind of time setting should I refer to?

Normally, it is suggested to follow the default ones, since they have higher accuracy and can cover most meaningful time period during a day. However, you can choose to customize based on your own behaviour. For instance, if you always work outside during the night, you need to change the stop time to a late time instance.
Please stop the service that is running before changing any configurations!
By detecting your presence in target building, the occupancy can be derived to support your smart building management.
The app offers three methods in total. You can choose among them for your own convenience.
If you are a professional who works on smart building, data analysis or related regions, you have more functions for visualization, etc.
Long-click to select/unselect method, short-click to see its guidance

Periodically check your location and compare with your current location, or use Geofence
Manually click on buttons to check in or out whenever you enter or leave target building

resources.string: It\'s hard to distinguish the duration around 1 hour either for dormant state or going out. Please refer to high sensitivity if the frequency of you going out for just around 1 hour is much less than the frequency of your device being in sleeping mode. This is very crucial for determining your occupancy.

Please make sure you have disabled or changed all settings that may block background service, like battery optimization, background service permit, etc!!! Please make sure you have turned on the WiFi service and location service!!!

If the address you selected turns out to be incorrect, it might be due to Geocoder in your device is not working. You can always choose to input manually but make sure it\'s exactly the same as other occupants!!!

Since not all devices work with firebase pushed notification, we also introduce local ones. In case you get duplicate notifications at the same time, you can turn this off because you device work well with cloud message.
The Google service is not available in your device, please do not use the map or positioning method but input manually.

You may receive this duplicate notification since your device may not work well with firebase cloud message. In case you are able to receive the cloud message, you can go to setting to disable local one to avoid duplicate notifications.
